subject: Re: [junit] Should JUnit determine if assert*/fail is called in testFoo?
msgSnippet: ... by first testing your code (and by first making your test fail), you are sure that your test method contains at least one assertion.  Since test first is
messageBody:
> Does anyone think JUnit should give some kind of warning
> when no assert* or fail is called in a test* method?

by first testing your code (and by first making your test fail), you are
sure that your test method contains at least one assertion. Since test
first is preached by Kent Beck, I don't think that this kind of warning
will be implemented. Only my opinion.

It is possible, but kind of messy: one static variable in the Assert
class, modify all assert methods to increment this variable and modify
the TestResult:run method.

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Bossicard
